title: (x) "Coney Island" 1940's movie title - hand drawn (similar to FF Moderne Gothics) {Stephen}
content:
Hi all - anybody know anything that looks like this? It’s from a 1940 film on coney island…thanks for the help!

[http://www.macgregorgordon.com/images/ConeyIsl1940.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060204183234/http:/www.macgregorgordon.com/images/ConeyIsl1940.jpg)
author: macgee

comments.content:
It’s not the same but [Futura Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20060204183234/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.8266.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=CONEY+ISLAND&sampleSize=60), was my first thought.

I’m sure others will come up with better ideas.

Richard

Probably hand drawn. Jim Parkinson’s [FF Moderne Gothics](http://web.archive.org/web/20060204183234/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=8&displayfontid=FF.10464.0.0&fontRendererText=coney+island) are also similar.

Definitely hand drawn — the legs of the two N’s are different widths. Stephen’s suggestion is good, and [Nick Curtis](http://web.archive.org/web/20060204183234/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Nick+Curtis) has many designs from this era, in both his freeware and buyware fonts.

- Mike Yanega
oh! I forgot about Nick’s Fonts - should have checked there first - thanks for your help!
